title: Drawing, "Ornamental woodwork detail", 1833
medium:
Brush, pen, watercolor, possibly gouache, black ink wash
Support: off-white paper mounted on off-white laid paper
inscribed: Inscribed by a later hand in graphite on mount at center: F tes de Juillet 1833; at lower margin: Peintures decoratives du theatre de Franconi/dans le grand carr des champs-elys es/1833.
description: Design for a cornice and a column.  Right: Design in graphite for a fluted column with a capital of broadly-shaped, stylized petals pointed downwards.  The column is surmounted by an elongated bell-shaped form, which in turn supports a smaller spherical form, upon which rests a conical form.  Left: Section of a brown colored cornice displayed at a leftward sloping angle.  The top band of the cornice is punctuated with silver roundels and the lower cornice is cut out with cusped arches, which are interspersed with small gold rimmed roundels.  The arches are edged with gold coloring.  Two thin, green-black lines extend vertically from the cornice, indicating the wall below.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Ornamental woodwork detail", 1833. Brush, pen, watercolor, possibly gouache, black ink wash
Support: off-white paper mounted on off-white laid paper. 1991-17-5.
